Reviews.Title: Works well in a TiVo Roamio
Reviews.Author: S. Goldstein "toys for big boys junky"
Reviews.Content: Thanks to one or two other reviewers that assured us that this drive could be swapped into a TiVo, and that the TiVo would automagically format and update it without any user intervention. But, they did not cover the low-end Roamio model.  With that reassurance, I ordered this drive to swap into my TiVo Roamio which comes with only a 500GB drive installed.  So, I swapped drives without ever having fired up the TiVo, and know what? the reviewer was 100% CORRECT.  It took about an hour after I plugged in the TiVo to be fully ready to roll, after my first having registered the TiVo on the 'net, and then connecting it to my home WiFi network.  The drive is quiet: I can detect no noise coming from the TiVo.  The top of the TiVo Roamio is a bit warm, but I have no idea if it is any warmer than if I had left the original smaller capacity drive installed.This pertains to the low-end TiVo Roamio model, the only new TiVo model that works with an over the air HD antenna, which is my use, having just cut the cable company cord. The hardest part, should you be interested in swapping out the original drive, is opening up the case.  An earlier set of directions that I found with a web search mentioned removing two screws from the back and sliding the case forward to reveal the innards.  Not so with my case.  I finally realized that I had to pop the lid off the case after removing only the middle screw from the back (Torx driver).  But, this is not the easiest thing to do because the lid is secured with several integral plastic pressure clips.  I was too lazy to go to my tool stash to retrieve a sparger, so I used a blunt-nosed table knife and inserted it CAREFULLY so as not to break any clips.  Other than that, it was just a matter of unscrewing some screws that held the drive in place using Torx drivers.  First the brackets that mount to the chassis (three screws), and then the four screws that secure the drive in the brackets.  Unplug the SATA connector; reverse the process using the replacement drive; snap the lid back on, and you're in business.Now I have more storage capacity for recorded shows than I will conceivably ever need.

Reviews.Title: Works great as Tivo Roamio upgrade drive.
Reviews.Author: Wing Wong "Winged Power Photography"
Reviews.Content: If you got a Roamio Plus(1TB) unit and wanted the capacity that the Roamio Pro unit offers, this is a great drive to facilitate an upgrade.Same type (Western Digital AV-GP) drive. When new Roamio arrived, just swapped out the 1TB with this 3TB drive. Powered up the unit and it re-initialized the drive and once all the updates has processed, the System Information screen showed over 450 hours of HD recording available. Sweet.

Reviews.Title: Direct replacement for Tivo Roamio
Reviews.Author: mp6453
Reviews.Content: Swapped this drive into my Tivo Roamio (base model), powered it on, and the system set up the drive automatically.  No configuration needed at all.

Reviews.Title: TiVo Roamio Drive
Reviews.Author: mark pelletier
Reviews.Content: Dropped one of these into my new TiVo Roamio Plus (plug an play in the new TiVo, no special formatting or setup - Nice).This is the 3TB version of the 1TB the TiVo came with.  Works silently just as expected.Will report reliability in a couple years! :)

Reviews.Title: Works great for my Roamio
Reviews.Author: William Gilbert
Reviews.Content: Perfect upgrade drive for my Roamio Plus.  Turn a few screws (actually hex) and power it up.  The Roamio formats the drive and loads the files needed for a quick and easy internal drive upgrade!  Wish Amazon sold the 4GB version of this drive that Weaknees is offering!

Reviews.Title: Excellent in Roamio!
Reviews.Author: K. Jones
Reviews.Content: I bought this hard drive as a replacement for my TiVo Roamio Plus.  Installation couldn't be more simple. I removed the new TiVo from the box and after removing the outer cover, I replaced the existing drive with this new 3TB model.  I connected the TiVo and the new drive was configured automagically!  I've been a TiVo owner since Series 1 (owned Series 2, HD, Series 3, Premiere) and this upgrade functionality is a breath of fresh air.  Nicely done, TiVo!  The drive has been working perfectly and I now have 450+ hours of HD space, which equals the TiVo Roamio Pro, for less than the cost of a TiVo Roamio Pro.

Reviews.Title: Put this in an esata enclosure and expanded my fios dvr capacity
Reviews.Author: drfundy
Reviews.Content: Bought this specifically to add capacity to my DVR. It works fine for that. The FiOS dvr formats it to 2TB and doesn't use the remaining 1TB. Oh well, so I have an extra 1TB if a future update to the DVR allows it to use larger drives. 2TB still added plenty of room and I never really delete anything now.

Reviews.Title: Perfect HTPC Drive...
Reviews.Author: Jason E. Smith "Impatient Reader"
Reviews.Content: Installed this in an HTPC (Slimline case) with Windows 7. No issues at all. I can record two HD streams while playing  back a third. I did not try making this a bootdrive, but I understand your motherboard must have special support for that to work. As a second disk--I was able to see the full 3TB without issue. I'm unclear on whether current media players (VLC, Media Center, etc.) support the ATI streaming command set which this drive supports, but perhaps future players will.

Reviews.Title: Used to upgrade Tivo Roamio base model
Reviews.Author: C Satterlee
Reviews.Content: Thanks to S Goldstein review I ordered this HD along with the base model Tivo Roamio.  I posted a video of me doing the swap on YouTube -[...]It's working great!

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!

Reviews.Content: Cant beat 3 TB for the price.  FYI make sure your OS can handle this one.  I know for a fact this wont work for anything Windows Vista or below and it takes special tools to get to work in linux.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded my Tivo Roamio
Reviews.Author: Brian R
Reviews.Content: Nice hard drive. I installed it in my Tivo Roamio. Installation was easy (with the right screwdrivers). I needed to re-setup everything. It will void my warranty but I'm ok with that.

Reviews.Title: Impressive speed for large files
Reviews.Author: John Feinberg "feinberj"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these drives for my Mac Pro.  When I copy very large (10Gb +) files from my Mac Pro to a MacBook Air over gigabit ethernet, I generally see average speeds of 100Mb (that's MegaBYTES) per second.  The only time I've seen a hard drive saturate a gigabit ethernet was from an SSD, but this drive will also hit 100Mb/sec.  Impressive!

Reviews.Title: great once you get a working unit
Reviews.Author: Rob W.
Reviews.Content: As with many others i ordered this HDD and the one i received was DOA. i went through Amazons great exchange process, had a replacement unit within 2 days that has been working wonderfully for almost a month now. This is a great price for a huge drive. Dont let the DOA issues concern you too much unless you are an extreme rush. If you happen to get a bad unit Amazon will address the issue promptly.I would give this 4 or 5 stars, but due to the rate of DOAs i dont think that would be fair.

Reviews.Title: This is a WD GREEN drive disguised-
Reviews.Author: Ronald Friend "Ronald Friend"
Reviews.Content: This drive did not mention that it was a green drive.I would not have purchased had I known it was a green drive.I am using this in a 16-channel DVR so reliability is worth the extra money.I don't have time to mess around with sending this back to get a non-green WD.I will update this for reliability.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded Tivo Roamio to 480hrs!
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: The 500GB Tivo Roamio is the only Roamio that supports antenna TV, but the 500GB capacity gets eaten up quickly if you like to keep recordings for any length of time. We like to keep episodes of Sesame Street or other children's programs available all the time for our son.Installation was easy and the Roamio automatically formatted the drive once it was installed. Now I have 480 hrs of HD recording capacity, much more than I'll ever need.  I searched "Tivo Roamio Upgrade" on youtube and found several video walk-throughs on how to swap the hard drives. Its a very straight-forward process.The extra hard drive space is nice for football season when I'll have games recording on three channels with an additional hour added to each game in case of overtime which would end up with 4+ hours for each game.**I've read online that the 4TB version will not automatically format when installed in the Roamio, so I went with this 3TB version**

Reviews.Title: TiVo Roamio Plus now a Pro
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: This is exactly the hard drive that you want to purchase to upgrade your TiVo Roamio to a Pro.  It was simple, open the TiVo up, unplug all the cables going into the hard drive, take the hard drive off the chassis, install the chassis onto the new hard drive and install it!  Once you turn on your TiVo you will have to go through guided setup again.Note: I did have a problem with my cable card where it no longer was provisioned to show premium channels - I have Comcast.  I recommend upgrading your hard drive prior to activating a cable card.

Reviews.Title: Used to upgrade my Revo America R16DVR4
Reviews.Author: Moparguy
Reviews.Content: Great improvement in recording time over the 500GB drive that came with the system. Be ready to do some formatting tricks to get the Linux operating system in the Revo DVR to recognize all 2800GB of usable space on the drive. At first it would only recognize 750GB and I was not happy. After a couple of tries at reformatting the drive using my PC the DVR saw all 2800GB. Not exactly plug and play as I had hoped. If I had to do it over I would perform a factory reset on the DVR then download any firmware updates to the DVR operating system prior to install. I think it would have worked the first time if I had followed that procedure. Working great now. Great product. Very happy with the final result.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Chris G. Umali
Reviews.Content: upgraded my Tivo Roamio with this hard drive, not I can infinite space.. okay.. actually just 3TB, but that's more space, than I can probably use (at this time).. lol..

Reviews.Content: the product worked flawlessly right out of the box. I would recommend and buy this item again. go buy one.

Reviews.Content: Purchased this drive to add more capacity to my Verizon DVR and it's working great!  I'll never run out of space, again.

Reviews.Title: Tivo drive

Reviews.Title: Set up fast under Windows 8.1 Pro
Reviews.Author: Paul A Downey
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I wanted - expand my existing storage. I am going to order a second one.Only negative - did not include any SATA or power cables. Had plenty of my own, so it was not a big problem.

Reviews.Title: Works Great with TIVO Roamio - better than older WD20EARS...
Reviews.Author: The Rhino "The Rhino"
Reviews.Content: Initially I installed an older 2TB WD20EARS drive in my basic TIVO Roamio but shows continually stuttered when I was recording multiple shows in the background...  Having owned & tweaked a Series 1 TIVO (years-ago) I knew that this was a problem with the hard drive & not the TIVO hardware/firmware...  After reading the TIVO forums I installed this 3TB "AV" drive & all is good.With TIVO Roamios, all you need to do is swap the hard drive & TIVO recognizes it & walks you through the setup again.  If you have a cable card, you will need to call your cable company to pair the (same) cable card to the new configuration-even if your cable card was paired to the same Roamio with stock/different hard drive...  If you have TWC, there is a specific TWC number to call for TIVO installations & you can find that number in the TIVO forums...  I was on-hold with TWC for about 5 minutes, it took about 5 minutes to relay my TIVO info to the tech, and then about 10 minutes more for my cable card to receive the appopriate activation codes - so, altogether about 20 minutes without requiring a tech to come to the house...

Reviews.Title: Great Computer Hard drive - Not just for DVR's and Video security systems
Reviews.Author: Michael Walterson
Reviews.Content: Using these as hard drives on Windows 8.1. Great drive for heavy, constant use such as a media server or backup drive that may be accessed many times per day. It is silent, would likely need a stethoscope to know it's running.Almost as easy as plug and play though the drive doesn't come with any cables, documentation or even mounting screws. You will need the (SATA data cable) and an existing SATA power connection or (ATA to SATA power adapter), both can be found for just a couple of dollars here on Amazon.(Windows 8 basic instructions) After plugging cables into drive and powering on you need to find (Run) prompt, either in desktop-Start button or search for "Run" within your extended tiles list. When the (Run) box appears, type in " diskmgmt.msc ". Let the Drive Management window load. Find your new drive at the bottom of the window, it should look different than the others and say "not partitioned" or something similar and Wont have a drive letter associated with it. Right click that device and Format, assign it a drive letter if you wish, no need to change any other options/settings. JUST BE SURE THIS IS NOT YOUR C:// DRIVE OR OTHER PRE-EXISTING DRIVE before you click Format.That's it! Close the Disk Management window and look under (This PC/ My Computer), It will say something like 2.72 TB, the other .28 is gone to system file allocation, etc.I will recommend this to people I know and am trying to find a reason to buy a few more.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Eric W. Thompson
Reviews.Content: The drive arrived quickly and in good shape. Easy to install and was used to increase the storage capability of my TiVo.

Reviews.Title: Bought me more time with my desktop
Reviews.Author: M. Platt "UpIrons"
Reviews.Content: My desktop pc acts more like a media server these days and it was running out of space. I bought one of those USB hard drive cloning docking stations and popped this drive in it and copied my media drive over to it using Acronis and it allowed me to expand to 3TB from a 1TB drive easily. It took awhile but mostly because I only have USB 2.0 on my desktop. Once it copied over I swapped that drive out with this new one and everything works great and I now have another 1.5TB free on my desktop/media server. It is also quieter than my previous drive although I ended up taking that drive and using it to replace the 500GB system disk a week later so it didn't really make my desktop any quieter but it would have if it had been my only drive.

Seems to be very reliable so far, silent, and cool running. Would definitely recommend for the constant 24x7 use this drive was designed for. For the price, you can't beat the 3TB capacity.

Reviews.Title: Worked great...

Reviews.Content: ...on my DirecTV HR44-500 for about 6 weeks, two weeks after Amazon's warranty expired.  Then it died.  I will try one more, because it is sweet when it works.

Reviews.Title: Good but nvidia chipset owners -it does not show 3tb unless you have this...
Reviews.Author: Salvatore J. Angelone
Reviews.Content: I am rewriting this review because I found a solution. So, if you are an owner of a slightly older PC (like me) from say 2006 or 7 and, you have a motherboard with the NVidia chipset you need at least version 15.58 of the driver - which as of this writing was not the one in the "latest drivers" section, however; you can simply type it into the search and once your machine restarts you can see all 3tb. You will find the driver on the NVidia website.To whom it may concern (customer)- this will save you at least 6-8 hours of wasted time and Amazon countless erroneous returns which is priceless. you're welcome! :)0 stars for having to spend my time to solve what Microsoft, NVidia and Western Digital should be preventing or, simply addressing. Note - none of those companies calls out the problem or, has their drivers identified such that you would know. Great companies - great products - execution - needs work. Learn from Apple.5 stars for Amazon selling a great product and a flawless return policy. Still 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great HTPC Drive
Reviews.Author: Streakybonehead
Reviews.Content: This is my second EURS drive. I always look for the EURS as I record from cable and this ensures the feed is recorded without hiccups.  It essentially ignores errors in the data feed - which is what you need in a video recording scenario and nothing can be done about these errors anyway.Fast and reliable

Reviews.Title: Popped into my Tivo Roamio Plus... working great
Reviews.Author: MadPB
Reviews.Content: As an aside, the Tivo Roamio models have a simple plug in replacement for drives... no special software tools needed.  And these WD drives are a perfect fit as far as specs go.  They're quiet, should be pretty reliable over time, and have a decent power envelope, similar to what came with the Tivo in the first place (I think the Plus comes with a WD10EURX 1 TB drive, so it's pretty similar).3 TB of space in a Tivo will get you 450+ hours of HD recording capacity. :)

Reviews.Title: THE AV series is sweet but be care full about this one
Reviews.Author: D. Hardingham "Magnusfl"
Reviews.Content: Most DVRs has a limit of 2TB along with some security DVRS so be very careful getting this instead of the 2TB which works in about everything before do you research on the limits of your hardware. hopefully the next generation will all see up to 6tb as with 4 TB drives on the market it only time before the AV line will be at 6TB.also the only application this drive has in a computer is for video never store data on it that you care about

Reviews.Title: Use with Directv HR-44
Reviews.Author: tw
Reviews.Content: I got this and a Rosewill RX-358 V2 to attach externally to a DirecTv HR-44 via eSata.  At first, the HR-44 did not see the external HD.  So, I removed the HD and connected it to a Windows XP machine via USB.  Then I *initialized* it (I think this was the key); also formatted it to 2TB (max limit for XP), and re-attached it to the HR-44.  The 44 recognized it, re-formatted it and is now using it.  All seems GREAT.  I have recorded TONS of stuff and still at 81% free.  I believe the HR-44 reformatted it to 3TB, but I have not checked on that.  Anyway, it seems from my experience, and other threads, that the HD needs to be initialized and formatted on a PC first, and then connected to the HR-44.  Happy viewing!

Reviews.Author: Kerry Amos
Reviews.Content: We use these in our CCTV DVRs and NVRs. No issues since switching over to these about 8 months ago.

As a secondary storage drive you cant beat 2.78TB storage after formatting for the price.

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly
Reviews.Author: Dana Goldstein
Reviews.Content: quiet, quick, low power consumption. Has performed exactly as expected. I'd recommend it for any always on home storage solution.

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Tom W
Reviews.Content: Got two of these units. So far so good. I'm keeping my fingers crossed. I was hoping to use these in a RAID1 setup but my onboard RAID controller couldn't deal with the 3TB size (older intel ICH10r chip set). I ended up using the Win7 disk management feature to mirror them instead (software RAID) it seems to work well with no noticeable performance issues.

Reviews.Title: Great ROI
Reviews.Author: Tubepower
Reviews.Content: Disk is reliable so far, working in a video station. Can stream 3 movies at the same time, for the price a great buy!

Reviews.Title: This was a good price but heavily write-optimized
Reviews.Author: Dave Bechtel
Reviews.Content: Just to let others know - this is a GREEN drive.  Great price for 3TB, but the read speed is not what I expected.Using Linux to write zeros to the entire raw device took ~7.5 hours (~135MB/sec according to dd, ~120MB/sec real-world according to iostat) with a low of ~77MB/sec(iostat) nearing the end of the 3TB.  Pretty respectable for a logical 512/4K actual sector drive.However, READ speed is hovering at almost exactly 50MB/sec for the entire duration so far. It's taken ~39 min to read ~120GB of zeros off the drive to test it. At this rate it will take between 2-3 times as long as the write operation to test every sector, even with the best optimizations I can throw at it (blockdev 8192 and using 2MB blocksize.) :-\ OK for the price perhaps, but if you want better speed be prepared to pay the price premium for the Black drive model - it's a pretty steep difference...Something to keep in mind tho, as of this writing you also get a *5-year warranty* with the Black model so IMHO you get what you pay for. Do like Ferris recommended and get what you can afford, but that 5-year is the best in the industry AFAIK. Shoutout and massive props to the WD team for RMA's, I have never had a problem with them in the last 10 years or so; you can even advance-ship the replacement drive and send your RMA back to them in the same packaging.As others have said, this drive is amazingly quiet. For my usage, it will probably suffice as it will be the sole backup drive for a 2TB RAIDZ2 array - heavy on writes/rsync but not so much reads. Enabling compression on the FS may help; YMMV.

Reviews.Title: great drive
Reviews.Author: netman
Reviews.Content: WD makes great drives, and if they fail their service is knowledgeable and prompt.  The green drives are quiet and run cool.

Reviews.Title: perfect shipping protection
Reviews.Author: Ahmed Lotfy
Reviews.Content: This HDD is perfect for HTPC and media storage; I received in a perfect protecting box, and installed easily with no problems

Reviews.Title: Did not work in my DVR
Reviews.Author: K. Lyon
Reviews.Content: I have a SageTV multimedia system in my home.  I put this into my SageTV Windows Home Server to upgrade the storage.  I chose this HDD because of it's size and purported DVR/multimedia features.SageTV is a like a TIVO on steroids.  My system can record 4 different HD video streams and playback to multiple locations (TV's and Computers).  The streams are received via a silicon dust HDHomeRun.Unfortunately, this drive would not start up quickly enough for the recording stream to start correctly.  So I received numerous recording start errors and recording halt errors, including when I attempted to record only one stream at a time.  When the recording did start - the first 1-2 minutes of a show would be missing.  My system before this drive and after this drive had rock solid reliability in starting and finishing recordings without errors.  I know it is the fault of this drive because, without changing anything else, when I replaced it with a 2TB WD Caviar Black I receive zero such errors.  The Caviar Black is able to record 3 HD streams at once and playback 2.  I have not tested it any further than that.  This drive would not consistently record even 1 properly.If it was merely a faulty drive I would give it more stars, But this was not a faulty drive, it is the way it was engineered.  It can play back ripped movies great.  It can play back previously recorded shows great.  Just don't expect great recording response.So, while this is touted as a DVR drive, I would caution that it may not work in your situation.Unfortunately, it took me awhile to trace the error to the drive itself, then get a replacement drive, and confirm the problem.  By that time the return window had passed and I am stuck with this drive.
